intro: Withania coronopus, commonly known as the crown corona, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It has a compact, bushy appearance with hairy stems and leaves that are usually opposite in arrangement. The fruit is a capsule that contains several small, black seeds.
